course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Basic Electronics
course.description: Covers basic electronic concepts, DC and AC electric circuits, basic analogue electronics: theories and applications of semiconductor diodes, transistors and operational amplifiers, and basic digital electronics.
course.prerequisites: A passing grade in AL Pure Mathematics / AL Applied Mathematics / AS Applied Mathematics / AS Mathematics and Statistics
course.corequisites: (For students without AL Pure Mathematics) MATH 1013 OR MATH 1014 OR MATH 1018 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1023 OR MATH 1024

reviews.author: Ho Ka Ying
reviews.title: ELEC course for MECH students
reviews.comment_content: Basic electronics: circuit, and some simple components (like capacitor, amplifier), and basic logic (binary system, AND gate OR gate...)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Srivastava speaks quite fast. Sometimes it may be a bit too fast for MECH student to follow (but if you are very logical and have some idea about electronics, it is OK). But he is nice generally.

The tutorials by Ricky is good! He summarizes the lectures well (so if you miss some points in the lectures, don't miss the tutorials), and helps a lot in understanding. He will also teach us to avoid common mistakes. He is experienced and passionate in teaching.
reviews.comment_workload: Although it may be a bit new to MECH students, as we do not go deep into each topics, it is still not too difficult. The assignments are short.
